title: Scraper for National Hockey League Data
text: , , endpoints unofficially documented (.e. hidden); therefore, responsibilities hit endpoints care. example, endpoints contain historical data mostly static data hit stored database (e.g. MySQL) query. know exact rate limits APIs; don’t ruin fun us!

what: Get boxscore by game, team, and player-type — get_game_boxscore
title: Get boxscore by game, team, and player-type — get_game_boxscore
text: get_game_boxscore() retrieves information player specified game, team, player_type, including limited ID, name, sweater number, goals, assists, +/-, hits, blocks, shots--goal, giveaways, takeaways, time ice, number shifts. exists many methods grab game IDs; easiest using get_games().

title: Get boxscore by game, team, and player-type — get_game_boxscore
Get boxscore by game, team, and player-type — get_game_boxscore
text: game integer Game ID team string 'home' 'away' player_type string 'forwards', 'defense', 'goalies'

title: Get boxscore by game, team, and player-type — get_game_boxscore
Get boxscore by game, team, and player-type — get_game_boxscore

what: Get goalie statistics by season — get_goalie_statistics
title: Get goalie statistics by season — get_goalie_statistics
text: get_goalie_statistics() retrieves information goalie game () specified season, teams, game_types, report. Check get_configuration() information combination report, is_aggregate is_game can provide; get_teams() team IDs; get_seasons() date references. dates must specified paired is_game default range return incomplete data (wide); ignored otherwise. soon reworked easier access.

title: Get goalie statistics by season — get_goalie_statistics
code: get_goalie_statistics(   season = get_season_now()$seasonId,   teams = 1:100,   game_types = 1:3,   dates = c("2025-01-01"),   report = "summary",   is_aggregate = FALSE,   is_game = FALSE )

title: Get goalie statistics by season — get_goalie_statistics
text: season integer YYYYYYYY teams vector integers Team ID(s) game_types vector integers 1=pre-season, 2=regular, 3=playoffs dates vector strings 'YYYY-MM-DD' *paired is_game report string is_aggregate boolean is_game boolean

title: Get goalie statistics by season — get_goalie_statistics
text: tibble one row per goalie game

title: Get goalie statistics by season — get_goalie_statistics
code: playoff_goalie_svr_20242025 <- get_goalie_statistics(   season=20242025,   teams=1:100,   game_types=c(3),   report='startedVsRelieved' )

code: get_team_statistics(   season = get_season_now()$seasonId,   report = "summary",   is_aggregate = FALSE,   is_game = FALSE,   dates = c("2025-01-01"),   game_types = 1:3 )

title: Get team statistics by season — get_team_statistics
text: season integer Season YYYYYYYY report string Report (check get_configuration() possible inputs) is_aggregate boolean isAggregate TRUE=regular playoffs combined, applicable is_game boolean isGame TRUE=rows games FALSE=rows teams dates vector strings Date(s) 'YYYY-MM-DD' (paired is_game; many dates result incomplete data) game_types vector integers Game-type(s) 1=pre-season, 2=regular, 3=playoffs

text: tibble one row per team game

what: Get World Showcase (WSC) play-by-play by game — get_wsc_play_by_play
title: Get World Showcase (WSC) play-by-play by game — get_wsc_play_by_play
text: get_wsc_play_by_play() retrieves WSC-provided information play specified game, including limited ID; time strength state occurrence; winning, losing, blocking, shooting, hitting, hit, scoring, assisting, committed-, drawn-, /served-player IDs; X Y coordinates. exists many methods grab game IDs; easiest using get_games().
